snippet: Three young women who fled to southern Turkey recalled their experiences as members of the Islamic State morality police in Raqqa, Syria.
abstract: Former members of Khansaa Brigade, Islamic State's all-female morality police, describe fraught process of deciding to join group after it took control of Raqqa, Syria, and being forced to flee later on; women say they joined to appease militants and ease daily life in much-changed city, only to suffer numerous horrors and be torn from their communities (Series: State of Terror).
lead_paragraph: Three young women who fled to southern Turkey recalled their experiences as members of the Islamic State morality police in Raqqa, Syria.

headline.main: ISIS Women and Enforcers in Syria Recount Collaboration, Anguish and Escape

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
